get.summary: Get status of report export job
get.description: Returns the status of a given report export job.

parameters.name: export_id
parameters.description: The ID of the exported report

get.summary: Get URL to download report export
get.description: Returns a JSON object which contains a link to download the report. The link is temporary and has to be regenerated after 30 minutes.
Get list of experience's versions without model

post.description: Schedules a job exporting a given Composer Conversions report.
Schedules a job exporting a given Composer Flow report.

post.summary: Schedule GDPR report export (by user ID)
post.description: Schedules a job exporting a GDPR report for a given user.

post.summary: Schedule GDPR report export (by browser ID)
post.description: Schedules a job exporting a GDPR report for a given browser.
Schedules an export job for the new version of Revenue Recognition report

post.summary: Schedule export of Passive churn prevention report export
post.description: Schedules a job exporting a given Passive churn prevention report with specified type.
Schedules an A/B test report export job. A legacy endpoint. We recommend using /export/schedule/composer/abTest.
Schedules a job exporting a given A/B test report.
Schedules a job exporting an AAM report in CSV format. Unlike the AAM monthly report available in UI, this report allows more options including date range.
Schedules a job exporting a given VX Conversion report.
Schedules a job exporting a given VX Subscription log.

post.summary: Schedule export of VX Subscription visual report
post.description: Schedules a job exporting a given VX Subscription visual report.
Schedules a job exporting a given Suspicious activity report.

post.summary: Schedule export of Revenue recognition transaction report export
post.description: Schedules a job exporting a given Revenue recognition transaction report. Unlike the Latest Revenue recognition transaction list available in UI, this report allows more options including date range.

post.summary: Schedule export of Revenue recognition summary report
post.description: Schedules a job exporting a given Revenue recognition summary report. Unlike the Latest revenue recognition summary available in UI, this report allows more options including date range.

code.description:
- 400: invalid export_id or the job is not finished

- 500: internal exception

attempt.description: Current or last attempt to process the export

report_request.description: The report request params, a JSON string

error_text.description: The error message when the Job status is INTERNAL_ERROR

file_name.description: The name of the exported report file

DownloadUrl.description: The url to download the exported report

sub_version_num.description: 3rd part in the report version notation (for legacy versions), derived from the model activity period

start.description: Start date in publisher time zone

end.description: The end date in the client's time zone

row_limit.description: Maximum row count in the by-page aggregation. Not limited if set to 0.

grouping.description: The grouping to be generated. If the value is ALL, a ZIP file will be returned, a CSV otherwise.

from.description: The report start date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd). By default, the date 30 days prior to today is used.

to.description: The report end date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd).By default, the current date is used.

file_name.description: The name of the generated file without an extension

from.description: The report start date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd). By default, version's start date is used.

to.description: The report end date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd).By default, the version's end date is used if the version is old, or today otherwise.

file_name.description: The name of the generated file without an extension

date_interval.description: Report Interval, allowable values: [DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR, CUSTOM]

term_id.description: The public term ID to filter by

term_type.description: The term type to filter by

grace_periods_enabled.description: If this parameter is to false, accrual transaction types will not appear

separate_adjustments.description: When this parameter is set to true, the report will separate revenues recognized previously up to the day of an adjustment (including refund and subscription exiting grace period without payment) and revenue to be recognized for both standard and accrual transaction types

from.description: The report start date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd)

to.description: The report end date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd)

file_name.description: The name of the generated file without an extension

report_type.description: Comma-separated list of KPI, LOGIC, DETAILED

term_type.description: Comma-separated list of The term type to filter by [Payment]

term_id.description: Comma-separated list of The public term ID to filter by

resource_id.description: Comma-separated list of Resource name to filter by

payment_provider.description: Comma-separated list of Payment provider ID to filter by

payment_method.description: Comma-separated list of Payment method name to filter by

decline_reason.description: Comma-separated list of Decline reason to filter by

from.description: The report start date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd). By default, version's start date is used.

to.description: The report end date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd).By default, the version's end date is used if the version is old, or today otherwise.

file_name.description: The name of the generated file without an extension

row_limit.description: Maximum row count in the by-page aggregation. Not limited if set to 0.

term_id.description: The public term ID to filter by

term_type.description: Comma-separated list of The term type to filter by

from.description: The report start date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd). By default, the date 30 days prior to today is used.

to.description: The report end date in the application time zone (yyyy-MM-dd).By default, the current date is used.

file_name.description: The name of the generated file without an extension

keyword.description: A keyword to search in any part of the data, or a full subscription ID

subscription_status.description: Comma-separated list of The subscription status (ACTIVE, UPGRADED, WONT_RENEW, CANCELED, PAYMENT_FAILED, EXPIRED)

upgrade_status.description: Comma-separated list of The upgrade status (SCHEDULED, COMPLETED, FAILED, NO_UPGRADE)

trial_status.description: Comma-separated list of The trial status (CURRENTLY_IN, ENDED_CONVERTED, ENDED_NOT_CONVERTED, NO_TRIAL)

trial_end_from.description: The "from" date for the trial end date range

trial_end_to.description: The "to" date for the trial end date range

auto_renew_disablement_date_from.description: The "from" date for the date range of auto renewal disabled

auto_renew_disablement_date_to.description: The "to" date for the date range of auto renewal disabled

start_date_from.description: The "from" date for the start date range

start_date_to.description: The "to" date for the start date range

end_date_from.description: The "from" date for the end date range

end_date_to.description: The "to" date for the end date range

last_billing_date_from.description: The "from" date for the last billing date range

last_billing_date_to.description: The "to" date for the last billing date range

next_billing_date_from.description: The "from" date for the next billing date range

next_billing_date_to.description: The "to" date for the next billing date range

currently_in_grace_period.description: Finds subscriptions currently in grace period

trial_price_from.description: The minimum value of trial price

trial_price_to.description: The maximum value of trial price

regular_price_from.description: The minimum value of regular price

regular_price_to.description: The maximum value of regular price

days_subscribed_from.description: The minimum number of days subscribed

days_subscribed_to.description: The maximum number of days subscribed
